page.title: 09FARMING IN STOCKTON.
page.content: AGRICULTURE IS THE MAJOR LAND USE WITHIN THIS REGION,THE AREA DIVIDED BETWEEN 7 FARMS (ECHOES HILL,LEAVENHALLS,STOCKTON GRANGE,EWDNESS,APLEY HOME FARM,OLD PARK FARM & NORTON HOUSE FARM.THE FARM SIZE VARIES FROM 128 TO 34O HA. FIVE OF THE FARMS ARE OPERATED BY TENANTS,ONLY 2 FARMS ARE OWNER-OCCUPIED.ALL FARMS ARE MIXED,COMBINING CROP PRODUCTION WITH LIVESTOCK REARING. CROP PRODUCTION IS INFLUENCED BY THE NATURE OF THE SANDY SOILS AND ALL THE FARMS GROW SPRING & WINTER WHEAT,WINTER BARLEY,POTATOES & SUGAR BEET(ALL SOLD AS CASH CROPS LOCALLY OR KEPT FOR WINTER FODDER).A HIGH PROPORTION OF THE LAND IS UNDER PERMANENT & LEY PASTURE FOR THE REARING OF FAT BEEFSTOCK, SHEEP AND PIGS.NO DAIRY CATTLE ARE REARED ON THE SEVEN FARMS.
